snippet: E.T.F.’s are popular for their low fees and their usefulness in building diversified portfolios. But buying an index-tracking E.T.F. doesn’t guarantee the same return as the index.
abstract: Exchange-traded funds are very popular for their low fees and their usefulness in building diversified portfolios buying an index-tracking ETF, however, does not guarantee the same return as the index; difference between fund's return and index's return, often called tracking error, can sometimes be significant.
lead_paragraph: E.T.F.’s are popular for their low fees and their usefulness in building diversified portfolios. But buying an index-tracking E.T.F. doesn’t guarantee the same return as the index.

headline.seo: Exchange-Traded Funds’ Tracking Error Is Often Overlooked
headline.main: In Exchange-Traded Funds, a Variable Worth Watching
headline.print_headline: In Exchange-Traded Funds, a Variable Worth Watching
